Turn off heat; set chicken aside to rest. Wash out pan.", "Heat pan used for chicken over medium-high heat. Add a drizzle of oil and remaining garlic; cook until fragrant,", "seconds. Stir in vinegar, honey, stock concentrate, and 1/", "cup water (1/", "cup for", "servings). Simmer until thick and glossy,", "minutes. Remove from heat and stir in", "TBSP butter (", "TBSP for", "Season with salt and pepper.", "Return chicken to pan and turn to coat in glaze. Divide chicken, broccoli, and potatoes between plates. Spoon any remaining glaze over chicken and serve."]

title: Hot Chocolate Fudge
ingredients: [{"name": "Chocolate Chips", "measure": "2 cups", "original": "2 cups Chocolate Chips"}, {"name": "Heavy Cream", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Heavy Cream"}, {"name": "Condensed Milk", "measure": "1 \u2013 14-ounce can", "original": "1 \u2013 14-ounce can Condensed Milk"}, {"name": "Vanilla Extract", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Vanilla Extract"}, {"name": "White Chocolate Chips", "measure": "1-\u2153 cups", "original": "1-\u2153 cups White Chocolate Chips"}, {"name": "Miniature Marshmallows", "measure": "1-\u00bd cups", "original": "1-\u00bd cups Miniature Marshmallows"}]
instructions: ["Line an 8-inch-square baking pan with wax paper or foil, and coat with non-stick spray", "In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the dark chocolate chips, heavy cream and half of the sweetened condensed milk. Microwave the dark chocolate mixture in 20-second intervals, stirring in between each interval, until the chocolate is melted", "Add the vanilla extract to the dark chocolate mixture and stir well until smooth", "Transfer the dark chocolate mixture into the prepared pan and spread into an even layer", "In a separate bowl, combine the white chocolate chips with the remaining half of the sweetened condensed milk. Microwave the white chocolate mixture in 20-second intervals, stirring in between each interval, until the chocolate is melted", "Evenly spread the white chocolate mixture on top of dark chocolate layer", "Top the chocolate layers with the Mallow Bits or miniature marshmallows, and gently press them down", "Refrigerate for 4 hours, or until set", "Remove the fudge and wax paper from the pan. Carefully peel all of the wax paper from the fudge", "Cut the fudge into bite-sized pieces and serve."]

title: Kentucky Fried Chicken
ingredients: [{"name": "Chicken", "measure": "1 whole", "original": "1 whole Chicken"}, {"name": "Oil", "measure": "2 quarts neutral frying", "original": "2 quarts neutral frying Oil"}, {"name": "Egg White", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Egg White"}, {"name": "Flour", "measure": "1 1/2 cups", "original": "1 1/2 cups Flour"}, {"name": "Brown Sugar", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Brown Sugar"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Salt"}, {"name": "paprika", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon paprika"}, {"name": "onion salt", "measure": "2 teaspoons", "original": "2 teaspoons onion salt"}, {"name": "chili powder", "measure": "1 teaspoon", "original": "1 teaspoon chili powder"}, {"name": "black pepper", "measure": "1 teaspoon", "original": "1 teaspoon black pepper"}, {"name": "celery salt", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon celery salt"}, {"name": "sage", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon sage"}, {"name": "garlic powder", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon garlic powder"}, {"name": "allspice", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon allspice"}, {"name": "oregano", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon oregano"}, {"name": "basil", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon basil"}, {"name": "marjoram", "measure": "1/2 teaspoon", "original": "1/2 teaspoon marjoram"}]
instructions: ["Preheat fryer to 350\u00b0F. Thoroughly mix together all the spice mix ingredients", "Combine spice mix with flour, brown sugar and salt", "Dip chicken pieces in egg white to lightly coat them, then transfer to flour mixture. Turn a few times and make sure the flour mix is really stuck to the chicken. Repeat with all the chicken pieces", "Let chicken pieces rest for 5 minutes so crust has a chance to dry a bit", "Fry chicken in batches. Breasts and wings should take 12-14 minutes, and legs and thighs will need a few more minutes. Chicken pieces are done when a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part reads 165\u00b0F", "Let chicken drain on a few paper towels when it comes out of the fryer. Serve hot."]

title: Key Lime Pie
ingredients: [{"name": "Digestive Biscuits", "measure": "300g", "original": "300g Digestive Biscuits"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "150g", "original": "150g Butter"}, {"name": "Condensed Milk", "measure": "400g", "original": "400g Condensed Milk"}, {"name": "Egg Yolks", "measure": "3", "original": "3 Egg Yolks"}, {"name": "Lime", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Lime"}, {"name": "Double Cream", "measure": "300ml", "original": "300ml Double Cream"}, {"name": "Icing Sugar", "measure": "1 tbls", "original": "1 tbls Icing Sugar"}, {"name": "Lime", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Lime"}]
instructions: ["Heat the oven to 160C/fan 140C/gas", "Whizz the biscuits to crumbs in a food processor (or put in a strong plastic bag and bash with a rolling pin). Mix with the melted butter and press into the base and up the sides of a 22cm loose-based tart tin. Bake in the oven for", "minutes. Remove and cool.\r\nPut the egg yolks in a large bowl and whisk for a minute with electric beaters. Add the condensed milk and whisk for", "minutes then add the zest and juice and whisk again for", "minutes. Pour the filling into the cooled base then put back in the oven for", "minutes. Cool then chill for at least", "hours or overnight if you like.\r\nWhen you are ready to serve, carefully remove the pie from the tin and put on a serving plate. To decorate, softly whip together the cream and icing sugar. Dollop or pipe the cream onto the top of the pie and finish with extra lime zest."]

title: Krispy Kreme Donut
ingredients: [{"name": "Yeast", "measure": "1/4 ounce", "original": "1/4 ounce Yeast"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "1/4 cup", "original": "1/4 cup Water"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "1 1/2 cups", "original": "1 1/2 cups Water"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1/2 cup", "original": "1/2 cup Sugar"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Eggs"}, {"name": "Shortening", "measure": "1/3 cup", "original": "1/3 cup Shortening"}, {"name": "Flour", "measure": "5 drops", "original": "5 drops Flour"}, {"name": "Canola Oil", "measure": "Sprinking", "original": "Sprinking Canola Oil"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "1/2 cup", "original": "1/2 cup Milk"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "2 cups", "original": "2 cups Sugar"}, {"name": "Vanilla", "measure": "1 1/2 cups", "original": "1 1/2 cups Vanilla"}, {"name": "Boiling Water", "measure": "6 tablespoons", "original": "6 tablespoons Boiling Water"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "1/3 cup", "original": "1/3 cup Butter"}]
instructions:
["Dissolve yeast in warm water in", "quart bowl. Add milk, sugar, salt, eggs, shortening and", "cups flour. Beat on low for", "seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on medium speed for", "minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Stir in remaining flour until smooth. Cover and let rise until double,", "minutes. (Dough is ready when indentation remains when touched.) Turn dough onto floured surface; roll around lightly to coat with flour. Gently roll dough 1/", "inch thick with floured rolling pin. Cut with floured doughnut cutter. Cover and let rise until double,", "minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in deep fryer to 350°. Slide doughnuts into hot oil with wide spatula. Turn doughnuts as they rise to the surface. Fry until golden brown, about", "minute on each side. Remove carefully from oil (do not prick surface); drain. Dip the doughnuts into creamy glaze set on rack.


Glaze: 
Heat butter until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth. Stir in water,", "tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency."]

title: Lasagna Sandwiches
ingredients: [{"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "1/4 cup", "original": "1/4 cup Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Chopped Onion", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Chopped Onion"}, {"name": "Dried Oregano", "measure": "1/2 tbs", "original": "1/2 tbs Dried Oregano"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "1/4 tsp", "original": "1/4 tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Bread", "measure": "8 slices", "original": "8 slices Bread"}, {"name": "Bacon", "measure": "8 slices", "original": "8 slices Bacon"}, {"name": "Tomato", "measure": "8 slices", "original": "8 slices Tomato"}, {"name": "Mozzarella", "measure": "4 slices", "original": "4 slices Mozzarella"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "2 1/2 Tbs", "original": "2 1/2 Tbs Butter"}]
instructions: ["In a small bowl, combine the first four ingredients; spread on four slices of bread. Layer with bacon, tomato and cheese; top with remaining bread.", "In a large skillet or griddle, melt", "tablespoons butter. Toast sandwiches until lightly browned on both sides and cheese is melted, adding butter if necessary.\r\n\r\nNutrition Facts", "sandwich:", "calories, 24g fat (12g saturated fat), 66mg cholesterol, 1094mg sodium, 35g carbohydrate (3g sugars, 2g fiber), 21g protein."]

title: New York cheesecake
ingredients: [{"name": "Butter", "measure": "85g", "original": "85g Butter"}, {"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "140g", "original": "140g Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1tbsp", "original": "1tbsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Cream Cheese", "measure": "900g", "original": "900g Cream Cheese"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "250g", "original": "250g Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Plain Flour", "measure": "3 tbs", "original": "3 tbs Plain Flour"}, {"name": "Lemon Juice", "measure": "1 \u00bd teaspoons", "original": "1 \u00bd teaspoons Lemon Juice"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "3 Large", "original": "3 Large Eggs"}, {"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "250ml", "original": "250ml Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Sour Cream", "measure": "150ml", "original": "150ml Sour Cream"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Lemon Juice", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Lemon Juice"}]
instructions:
["Position an oven shelf in the middle of the oven. Preheat the oven to fan 160C/conventional 180C/gas", "Line the base of a 23cm springform cake tin with parchment paper. For the crust, melt the butter in a medium pan. Stir in the biscuit crumbs and sugar so the mixture is evenly moistened. Press the mixture into the bottom of the pan and bake for", "minutes. Cool on a wire rack while preparing the filling.
For the filling, increase the oven temperature to fan 200C/conventional 240C/gas", "In a table top mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the soft cheese at medium-low speed until creamy, about", "minutes. With the mixer on low, gradually add the sugar, then the flour and a pinch of salt, scraping down the sides of the bowl and the paddle twice.
Swap the paddle attachment for the whisk. Continue by adding the vanilla, lemon zest and juice. Whisk in the eggs and yolk, one at a time, scraping the bowl and whisk at least twice. Stir the 284ml carton of soured cream until smooth, then measure 200ml/7fl oz (just over 3⁄", "of the carton). Continue on low speed as you add the measured soured cream (reserve the rest). Whisk to blend, but don't over-beat. The batter should be smooth, light and somewhat airy.
Brush the sides of the springform tin with melted butter and put on a baking sheet. Pour in the filling - if there are any lumps, sink them using a knife - the top should be as smooth as possible. Bake for", "minutes. Reduce oven temperature to fan 90C/conventional 110C/gas 1⁄", "and bake for", "minutes more. If you gently shake the tin, the filling should have a slight wobble. Turn off the oven and open the oven door for a cheesecake that's creamy in the centre, or leave it closed if you prefer a drier texture. Let cool in the oven for", "hours. The cheesecake may get a slight crack on top as it cools.
Combine the reserved soured cream with the 142ml carton, the sugar and lemon juice for the topping. Spread over the cheesecake right to the edges. Cover loosely with foil and refrigerate for at least", "hours or overnight.
Run a round-bladed knife around the sides of the tin to loosen any stuck edges. Unlock the side, slide the cheesecake off the bottom of the tin onto a plate, then slide the parchment paper out from underneath."]

title: Pancakes
ingredients: [{"name": "Flour", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Flour"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "2 large", "original": "2 large Eggs"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "300ml", "original": "300ml Milk"}, {"name": "Sunflower Oil", "measure": "1 tbls", "original": "1 tbls Sunflower Oil"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Sugar"}, {"name": "Raspberries", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Raspberries"}, {"name": "Blueberries", "measure": "to serve", "original": "to serve Blueberries"}]
instructions: ["Put the flour, eggs, milk,", "tbsp oil and a pinch of salt into a bowl or large jug, then whisk to a smooth batter. Set aside for", "mins to rest if you have time, or start cooking straight away.\r\nSet a medium frying pan or cr\u00eape pan over a medium heat and carefully wipe it with some oiled kitchen paper. When hot, cook your pancakes for", "min on each side until golden, keeping them warm in a low oven as you go.\r\nServe with lemon wedges and sugar, or your favourite filling. Once cold, you can layer the pancakes between baking parchment, then wrap in cling film and freeze for up to", "months."]

title: Peach & Blueberry Grunt
ingredients: [{"name": "Corn Flour", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Corn Flour"}, {"name": "Orange", "measure": "Juice of 2", "original": "Juice of 2 Orange"}, {"name": "Orange", "measure": "Zest of 1", "original": "Zest of 1 Orange"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Peaches", "measure": "6", "original": "6 Peaches"}, {"name": "Blueberries", "measure": "250g", "original": "250g Blueberries"}, {"name": "Self-raising Flour", "measure": "200g", "original": "200g Self-raising Flour"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "50g", "original": "50g Butter"}, {"name": "Muscovado Sugar", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Muscovado Sugar"}, {"name": "Cinnamon", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Cinnamon"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "6 tblsp", "original": "6 tblsp Milk"}]
instructions:
["Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas", "Butter a wide shallow ovenproof dish. Blend the cornflour with the orange zest and juice, and put in a large pan with the sugar. Halve, stone and slice the peaches and add to the pan. Bring slowly to the boil, stirring gently until the sauce is shiny and thickened, about", "mins. Remove from the heat, stir in the blueberries and tip into the prepared dish.
Tip the flour into a mixing bowl and add the 50g butter. Rub the butter into the flour until it resembles fine breadcrumbs, then stir in half the sugar. Mix the remaining sugar with the cinnamon and set aside.
Add the milk to the dry ingredients and mix to a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly. Roll out to an oblong roughly", "x 24cm. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle evenly with the spicy sugar. Roll up from one long side and cut into", "slices. Arrange around the top of the dish, leaving the centre uncovered.
Bake for", "mins, until the topping is crisp and golden. Serve warm."]

title: Peanut Butter Cheesecake
ingredients: [{"name": "Butter", "measure": "50g", "original": "50g Butter"}, {"name": "Peanut Cookies", "measure": "175g", "original": "175g Peanut Cookies"}, {"name": "Gelatine Leafs", "measure": "5", "original": "5 Gelatine Leafs"}, {"name": "Ricotta", "measure": "500g", "original": "500g Ricotta"}, {"name": "Peanut Butter", "measure": "175g", "original": "175g Peanut Butter"}, {"name": "Golden Syrup", "measure": "175g", "original": "175g Golden Syrup"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "150ml", "original": "150ml Milk"}, {"name": "Double Cream", "measure": "275ml", "original": "275ml Double Cream"}, {"name": "Light Brown Soft Sugar", "measure": "2 tblsp", "original": "2 tblsp Light Brown Soft Sugar"}, {"name": "Peanut Brittle", "measure": "Crushed", "original": "Crushed Peanut Brittle"}]
instructions: ["Oil and line a 20cm round loose- bottomed cake tin with cling film, making it as smooth as possible. Melt the butter in a pan. Crush the biscuits by bashing them in a bag with a rolling pin, then stir them into the butter until very well coated. Press the mixture firmly into the base of the tin and chill", "Soak the gelatine in water while you make the filling. Tip the ricotta into a bowl, then beat in the peanut butter and syrup. Ricotta has a slightly grainy texture so blitz until smooth with a stick blender for a smoother texture if you prefer", "Take the soaked gelatine from the water and squeeze dry. Put it into a pan with the milk and heat very gently until the gelatine dissolves. Beat into the peanut mixture, then tip onto the biscuit base. Chill until set", "To freeze, leave in the tin and as soon as it is solid, cover the surface with cling film, then wrap the tin with cling film and foil", "To defrost, thaw in the fridge overnight", "To serve, carefully remove from the tin. Whisk the cream with the sugar until it holds its shape, then spread on top of the cheesecake and scatter with the peanut brittle."]

title: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: [{"name": "Peanut Butter", "measure": "1 cup", "original": "1 cup Peanut Butter"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1/2 cup", "original": "1/2 cup Sugar"}, {"name": "Egg", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Egg"}]
instructions: ["Preheat oven to 350\u00baF (180\u00baC)", "In a large bowl, mix together the peanut butter, sugar, and egg", "Scoop out a spoonful of dough and roll it into a ball. Place the cookie balls onto a nonstick baking sheet", "For extra decoration and to make them cook more evenly, flatten the cookie balls by pressing a fork down on top of them, then press it down again at a 90\u00ba angle to make a criss-cross pattern", "Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies are golden brown", "Remove from baking sheet and cool", "Enjoy!"]

title: Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: [{"name": "Pumpkin", "measure": "750g", "original": "750g Pumpkin"}, {"name": "Shortcrust Pastry", "measure": "350g", "original": "350g Shortcrust Pastry"}, {"name": "Plain Flour", "measure": "Dusting", "original": "Dusting Plain Flour"}, {"name": "Caster Sugar", "measure": "140g", "original": "140g Caster Sugar"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp Salt"}, {"name": "Nutmeg", "measure": "\u00bd tsp", "original": "\u00bd tsp Nutmeg"}, {"name": "Cinnamon", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Cinnamon"}, {"name": "Eggs", "measure": "2 Beaten", "original": "2 Beaten Eggs"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "25g", "original": "25g Butter"}, {"name": "Milk", "measure": "175g", "original": "175g Milk"}, {"name": "Icing Sugar", "measure": "1 tblsp", "original": "1 tblsp Icing Sugar"}]
instructions:
["Place the pumpkin in a large saucepan, cover with water and bring to the boil. Cover with a lid and simmer for", "mins or until tender. Drain pumpkin; let cool.
Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas", "Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface and use it to line a 22cm loose-bottomed tart tin. Chill for", "mins. Line the pastry with baking parchment and baking beans, then bake for", "mins. Remove the beans and paper, and cook for a further", "mins until the base is pale golden and biscuity. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly.
Increase oven to 220C/200C fan/gas", "Push the cooled pumpkin through a sieve into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the sugar, salt, nutmeg and half the cinnamon. Mix in the beaten eggs, melted butter and milk, then add to the pumpkin purée and stir to combine. Pour into the tart shell and cook for", "mins, then reduce the temperature to 180C/160C fan/gas", "Continue to bake for", "mins until the filling has just set.
Leave to cool, then remove the pie from the tin. Mix the remaining cinnamon with the icing sugar and dust over the pie. Serve chilled."]

title: Roasted Eggplant With Tahini, Pine Nuts, and Lentils
ingredients: [{"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "2 tablespoons", "original": "2 tablespoons Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Carrots", "measure": "2 small cut into chunks", "original": "2 small cut into chunks Carrots"}, {"name": "Celery", "measure": "2 small stalks", "original": "2 small stalks Celery"}, {"name": "Onion", "measure": "1 medium finely diced", "original": "1 medium finely diced Onion"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "6 medium cloves sliced", "original": "6 medium cloves sliced Garlic"}, {"name": "Brown Lentils", "measure": "12 ounces (340g)", "original": "12 ounces (340g) Brown Lentils"}, {"name": "Bay Leaves", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Bay Leaves"}, {"name": "Water", "measure": "4 cups", "original": "4 cups Water"}, {"name": "Salt", "measure": "Pinch", "original": "Pinch Salt"}, {"name": "Apple Cider Vinegar", "measure": "2 teaspoons (10ml)", "original": "2 teaspoons (10ml) Apple Cider Vinegar"}, {"name": "Pepper", "measure": "Pinch", "original": "Pinch Pepper"}, {"name": "Egg Plants", "measure": "2 large", "original": "2 large Egg Plants"}, {"name": "Rosemary", "measure": "4 sprigs", "original": "4 sprigs Rosemary"}, {"name": "Pine nuts", "measure": "1/4 cup", "original": "1/4 cup Pine nuts"}, {"name": "Parsley", "measure": "2 tablespoons", "original": "2 tablespoons Parsley"}]
instructions: ["For the Lentils: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 450\u00b0F to prepare for roasting eggplant. Meanwhile, heat", "tablespoons olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add carrots, celery, and onion and cook, stirring, until softened but not browned, about", "minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about", "seconds. Add lentils, bay leaves, stock or water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a simmer, cover with the lid partially ajar, and cook until lentils are tender, about", "minutes. (Top up with water if lentils are at any point not fully submerged.) Remove lid, stir in vinegar, and reduce until lentils are moist but not soupy. Season to taste with salt and pepper, cover, and keep warm until ready to serve.", "For the Eggplant: While lentils cook, cut each eggplant in half. Score flesh with the tip of a paring knife in a cross-hatch pattern at", "inch intervals. Transfer to a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet, cut side up, and brush each eggplant half with", "tablespoon oil, letting each brushstroke be fully absorbed before brushing with more. Season with salt and pepper. Place a rosemary sprig on top of each one. Transfer to oven and roast until completely tender and well charred,", "minutes. Remove from oven and discard rosemary.", "To Serve: Heat", "tablespoons olive oil and pine nuts in a medium skillet set over medium heat. Cook, tossing nuts frequently, until golden brown and aromatic, about", "minutes. Transfer to a bowl to halt cooking. Stir half of parsley and rosemary into lentils and transfer to a serving platter. Arrange eggplant halves on top. Spread a few tablespoons of tahini sauce over each eggplant half and sprinkle with pine nuts. Sprinkle with remaining parsley and rosemary, drizzle with additional olive oil, and serve."]

title: Rocky Road Fudge
ingredients: [{"name": "Miniature Marshmallows", "measure": "2 cups", "original": "2 cups Miniature Marshmallows"}, {"name": "Chocolate Chips", "measure": "3 cups", "original": "3 cups Chocolate Chips"}, {"name": "Peanut Butter", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Peanut Butter"}, {"name": "Vanilla Extract", "measure": "1 tsp", "original": "1 tsp Vanilla Extract"}, {"name": "Peanuts", "measure": "1 \u00bc cups", "original": "1 \u00bc cups Peanuts"}]
instructions: ["Line an 8-inch-square baking pan with wax paper or foil, and coat with non-stick spray", "Pour \u00bd cup of the miniature marshmallows into the bottom of the lined baking dish", "In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the chocolate chips and peanut butter. Microwave the chocolate mixture in 20-second intervals, stirring in between each interval, until the chocolate is melted", "Add the vanilla extract and stir well, until smooth", "Reserve 2 tablespoons of the chopped almonds or peanuts, and set aside", "Fold 1 \u00bd cups of the miniature marshmallows and the remaining chopped nuts into the chocolate mixture", "Transfer the chocolate mixture into the prepared pan and spread into an even layer. Immediately top with the reserved chopped nuts and the mallow bits or additional miniature marshmallows, if using", "Refrigerate for 4 hours, or until set", "Remove the fudge and wax paper from the pan. Carefully peel all of wax paper from the fudge", "Cut the fudge into bite-sized pieces and serve."]

title: Salmon Eggs Eggs Benedict
ingredients: [{"name": "Eggs", "measure": "4", "original": "4 Eggs"}, {"name": "White Wine Vinegar", "measure": "2 tbs", "original": "2 tbs White Wine Vinegar"}, {"name": "English Muffins", "measure": "2", "original": "2 English Muffins"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "To serve", "original": "To serve Butter"}, {"name": "Smoked Salmon", "measure": "8 slices", "original": "8 slices Smoked Salmon"}, {"name": "Lemon Juice", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp Lemon Juice"}, {"name": "White Wine Vinegar", "measure": "2 tsp", "original": "2 tsp White Wine Vinegar"}, {"name": "Egg", "measure": "3 Yolkes", "original": "3 Yolkes Egg"}, {"name": "Unsalted Butter", "measure": "125g", "original": "125g Unsalted Butter"}]
instructions: ["First make the Hollandaise sauce. Put the lemon juice and vinegar in a small bowl, add the egg yolks and whisk with a balloon whisk until light and frothy. Place the bowl over a pan of simmering water and whisk until mixture thickens. Gradually add the butter, whisking constantly until thick \u2013 if it looks like it might be splitting, then whisk off the heat for a few mins. Season and keep warm", "To poach the eggs, bring a large pan of water to the boil and add the vinegar. Lower the heat so that the water is simmering gently. Stir the water so you have a slight whirlpool, then slide in the eggs one by one. Cook each for about 4 mins, then remove with a slotted spoon", "Lightly toast and butter the muffins, then put a couple of slices of salmon on each half. Top each with an egg, spoon over some Hollandaise and garnish with chopped chives."]

title: Salted Caramel Cheescake
ingredients: [{"name": "Digestive Biscuits", "measure": "250g", "original": "250g Digestive Biscuits"}, {"name": "Pretzels", "measure": "75g", "original": "75g Pretzels"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "135g", "original": "135g Butter"}, {"name": "Cream Cheese", "measure": "450g", "original": "450g Cream Cheese"}, {"name": "Vanilla Extract", "measure": "1tsp", "original": "1tsp Vanilla Extract"}, {"name": "Icing Sugar", "measure": "100g", "original": "100g Icing Sugar"}, {"name": "Caramel", "measure": "150g", "original": "150g Caramel"}, {"name": "Sea Salt", "measure": "1tsp", "original": "1tsp Sea Salt"}, {"name": "Double Cream", "measure": "300ml", "original": "300ml Double Cream"}, {"name": "Caramel Sauce", "measure": "drizzle", "original": "drizzle Caramel Sauce"}, {"name": "Toffee Popcorn", "measure": "Top", "original": "Top Toffee Popcorn"}, {"name": "Pretzels", "measure": "Top", "original": "Top Pretzels"}]
instructions: ["Blitz the biscuits and the pretzels in a food processor and mix the biscuits with the melted butter. Spread on the bottom of an 8\u2033/20cm Deep Springform Tin and press down firmly. Leave to set in the fridge whilst you make the rest!", "Using an electric mixer, I use my KitchenAid with the whisk attachment, whisk together the cream cheese, vanilla, and icing sugar until smooth and then add the caramel and whisk again until smooth and lump free \u2013 this could take a couple of minutes, I whisk it at half speed so not too quick or slow!", "Pour in the double cream & Salt flakes and continue to whisk for a couple of minutes until its very thick and mousse like (I mix it on a medium speed, level 6/", "\u2013 Now this could take up to", "minutes depending on your mixer, but you seriously have to stick at it \u2013 it will hold itself completely when finished mixing (like a meringue does!) If you don\u2019t mix it enough it will not set well enough, but don\u2019t get impatient and whisk it really quick because that\u2019ll make it split! Spread over the biscuit base and leave to set in the fridge overnight.", "Remove the Cheesecake from the tin carefully and decorate the cheesecake \u2013 I drizzled over some of the spare caramel, and then some Toffee Popcorn and more Pretzels!"]

title: Skillet Apple Pork Chops with Roasted Sweet Potatoes & Zucchini
ingredients: [{"name": "Potatoes", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Potatoes"}, {"name": "Apples", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Apples"}, {"name": "Garlic", "measure": "2 cloves", "original": "2 cloves Garlic"}, {"name": "Lemon", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Lemon"}, {"name": "Pork", "measure": "2", "original": "2 Pork"}, {"name": "Zucchini", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Zucchini"}, {"name": "Chicken Stock", "measure": "1", "original": "1 Chicken Stock"}, {"name": "Vegetable Oil", "measure": "1 tbsp", "original": "1 tbsp Vegetable Oil"}, {"name": "Sugar", "measure": "1 1/2 tsp", "original": "1 1/2 tsp Sugar"}, {"name": "Butter", "measure": "2 tbsp", "original": "2 tbsp Butter"}]
instructions: ["Serves", "Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to", "degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Dice sweet potatoes into 1/", "inch pieces. Toss on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for", "minutes (we'll roast the zucchini then).", "Meanwhile, halve and core apple; thinly slice into half-moons. Peel and finely chop garlic. Quarter lemon. Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; cut crosswise into 1/", "inch-thick half-moons. Toss on a second baking sheet with a drizzle of oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside.", "Pat pork dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned and cooked through,", "minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate.", "Once sweet potatoes have roasted", "minutes, transfer baking sheet with zucchini to middle rack and continue roasting until both veggies are browned and softened,", "minutes more.", "Meanwhile, melt", "TBSP butter (", "TBSP for", "servings) in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add apple and season with salt and pepper. Cook, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan, until apple is slightly softened,", "minutes. Add garlic; cook until fragrant,", "seconds. Add 1/z cup water (3/", "cup for", ", stock concentrate, and 11/", "tsp sugar (", "tsp for", "Cook, stirring, until sauce has thickened and apple is very tender,", "minutes. Season with salt and pepper.", "Remove pan with apple from heat; stir in", "TBSP butter (", "TBSP for", "servings) and a squeeze of lemon juice. Divide pork, zucchini, and sweet potatoes between plates. Top pork with glazed apple sauce. Top zucchini with a squeeze of lemon juice."]

title: Soy-Glazed Meatloaves with Wasabi Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Carrots

title: Stovetop Eggplant With Harissa, Chickpeas, and Cumin Yogurt
ingredients: [{"name": "Olive Oil", "measure": "4 tablespoons", "original": "4 tablespoons Olive Oil"}, {"name": "Egg Plants", "measure": "6 small", "original": "6 small Egg Plants"}, {"name": "Harissa Spice", "measure": "\u00bd tablespoon", "original": "\u00bd tablespoon Harissa Spice"}, {"name": "Chickpeas", "measure": "1 can", "original": "1 can Chickpeas"}, {"name": "Cherry Tomatoes", "measure": "2 cups halved", "original": "2 cups halved Cherry Tomatoes"}, {"name": "Greek yogurt", "measure": "1 1/2 cups", "original": "1 1/2 cups Greek yogurt"}, {"name": "Ground cumin", "measure": "1 tablespoon", "original": "1 tablespoon Ground cumin"}, {"name": "Parsley", "measure": "\u00bd cup", "original": "\u00bd cup Parsley"}]
instructions: ["Heat the oil in a", "inch skillet over high heat until shimmering. Add the eggplants and lower the heat to medium. Season with salt and pepper as you rotate the eggplants, browning them on all sides. Continue to cook, turning regularly, until a fork inserted into the eggplant meets no resistance (you may have to stand them up on their fat end to finish cooking the thickest parts), about", "minutes, lowering the heat and sprinkling water into the pan as necessary if the eggplants threaten to burn or smoke excessively.", "Mix the harissa, chickpeas and tomatoes together, then add to the eggplants. Cook until the tomatoes have blistered and broken down, about", "minutes more. Season with salt and pepper and add water as necessary to thin to a saucy consistency. Meanwhile, combine the yogurt and cumin in a serving bowl. Season with salt and pepper.", "Top the eggplant mixture with the parsley, drizzle with more extra virgin olive oil, and serve with the yogurt on the side."]
